1.content:
Alex Drake was always an ordinary student. He went to high school, was an average student and basically faded into the woodwork.

He went home every day to see his annoying 14 year old brother, Robert, and hear his parents talk about how great his older sister, Caitlin, was. 23 and she still came home often.

Anyways, one night he went home late after partying (or being at a party and watching everyone else). He went to sleep. And stayed asleep.


And this is where our story begins...

In his dreams, a nightmarish figure kept appearing. Each time it appeared differently. One, a Grim Reaper-esque figure with burning eyes. Another time a perky Goth girl...who when she opened her mouth, revealed a snake's tongue and fangs. The versions kept changing and never ceased. Always telling him he would never wake up. And if he did, it would be in a way that made him wish he would stay in his nightmares.

So far, nothing too nightmarish had happened. But then...the figure disappeared. And Alex found himself in front of five doors. He was in the middle of nowhere, like purgatory. Nothing but white space and the five doors. Which door does he go in?
1.title: The Beginning, A Dream and Doors

choices: Get out of this creepy house.
11.content:
Entering this door, he ended up in his house...like he was awake. But he wasn't. Though he didn't know that.

Looking around, he looked at a bookcase. On top of it was a portrait of his family...but he wasn't in it. Caitlin then walked around the corner, her usual Playmate looking way and stared at Alex. It was like she had never seen him before. Like he was a stranger.

Caitlin said, "Who are you?" Alex replied, "I'm your brother, don't you remember?" Caitlin shook her head.


Alex looked at Caitlin, who merely looked confused as she licked her lips. Alex wondered why she would lick her lips. A noise went off and Caitlin went off to the kitchen, the oven apparently beeping. Maybe that was it. She was hungry.

Alex looked around the house and eventually met up with his parents and brother, Robert. But they didn't know him either. Things were getting slightly weird. He sat down on a couch, pondering what to do next.

Turning on the nearby TV, a kid's show was on. Talking purple dinosaurs. One said, "Kids, remember loneliness is just a state of mind." Then the next said, "If you're lonely, talk to someone you trust."


Then the room started getting smaller and smaller until it crushed itself, crushing Alex to death. Then he "woke" up in the guest room bed. Caitlin, Robert and his parents were there. But they were...different. Each in a different way.

Caitlin kept checking herself out. Lusting over herself. Touching herself. This was odd, she was pretty but she wasn't in love with herself...at least not to this extent.

Robert kept cracking his knuckles. Over and over. Again and again.

Mom kept scratching herself. Never stopping.

Dad was just...blank. No emotion whatsoever.


Then they all started humming Frere Jacques. Wait, doesn't that song translate to "Are you sleeping?"

Something had to be wrong. This whole place was wrong, crushed to death and then waking up like it was nothing...to a creepier version of your family? ...Maybe you should talk to one of them. Maybe that would help. Hopefully.


Then you heard rain outside. Looking out the window, it was raining. That was oddly timed. But this whole thing is just too messed. Alex thought maybe he could get answers from his family. Talk to one of them, see what was going on...or he could leave and get out of this freaky house.

What does he do?
11.title: A Slightly Different Family

choices: Alex should finally escape this place!
111.content:
Alex decided it was best to talk to Caitlin. He felt for some reason that he could trust her.

Alex went to talk to Caitlin, but first heard the radio go off. "Cannibalism is the highest form of love. If you really love your family, remember to use nothing but the finest of spices."

Alex was slightly disturbed at this broadcast. But it got worse. He found Caitlin in the kitchen. That previous beeping was just the oven after all.


Caitlin, wearing...surgical gloves for some reason, pulled something out of the oven. She pulled something out of the oven. Licking her lips, she pulled out a human head, falling apart from the heat.


This made Alex want to vomit. Caitlin was smiling for some reason. Caitlin said, "Do you want to join us for some food?"


Alex felt uneasy at this but before he could answer, Caitlin droped the head on the floor and went off somewhere humming and looking at herself with lustful pleasure. And a continued licking of her lips.


Alex thought he should either finally get out of here...or follow Caitlin. Or, he could stay for the "meal"...
111.title: Talk to Caitlin.

choices: He falls into an endless abyss.
He gets chased by the cops.
1111.content: Alex, knowing that there might be no other opportunity to escape, rushed straight for the door. Just as he opened it, thinking that this nightmare would finally end...
1111.title: Don't stand there like a footstool: RUN!!!

11112.content: Alex opened the door ever so slightly, hoping there was nothing on the other side of the doorway. Taking a look, he found nothing outside of the house...at least, not yet. "Coast is clear, the fuzz is gone, the cheddar is mine: Time to..." It was then that Alex stopped: Why was he talking like a mobster? He wasn't a mobster, but he'd soon be a wanted man. Searchlights trained on him, and instead of being outside his house on the ground floor, he was on the third floor of a mansion! "Alright, wiseguy," said a cop on the ground "you can't escape! We've got men everywhere with guns trained on you, so drop the money and put your hands up!". It was clear that the cops weren't giving him much of a choice. The way Alex saw it, he could: a) Try to run, b) Surrender to Johnny Law or c) Jump and end this nightmare. "Alright, I'm gonna take..."
11112.title: Shit! It's the fuzz!!!

111122.content: "Okay," said Alex "option A: no good!" With careful consideration, Alex chose option...
111122.title: The only way out of this mess.

choices: The power tool shed out back.
11113.content: Alex slowly walked out of the house, thinking to himself "It's quiet...perhaps too quiet!" Alex knew that something was wrong: For instance, that weird family- Sure, his family was weird (that's suppossed to be their job), but that corners on a whole new kind of weird. Secondly, the whole "cannibalism is the best way to show love",or...something along the lines of that, just scared the shit out of him. "Something's up...and I don't think I like where it's going!" Alex said. "Gotta find something to defend myself with!" thought Alex. He looked around for a blunt object, a gun...anything! Alex went looking for a weapon in...
11113.title: It's quiet....too quiet!

111131.content: "Keep your mitts off my power tools!": That's what Alex's dad had always said whenever Alex went playing around in the tool shed. However, that was then, and this is now! Alex crept in, the hairs on the back of his neck standing on end, his eyes swishing back and forth as quickly as a dog tail, as he searched for the right implement to defend himself with. As he searched for the right tool, Alex had no idea that he would soon have company. The company was...
111131.title: Keep your mitts off my power tools!

choices: Alex leaves Caitlin and attempts to get out of the house
1112.content:
Alex decides to follow Caitlin. He wanted to find out just where she was going. And get some answers.

Following Caitlin, Alex noticed the house was started to tilt on an angle...yet he could still walk normally. Odd. To say the least.

Continuing to follow Caitlin, the trail seemed to go forever. Never ending. Hallways led to hallways. Over and over. The more he walked, the more his feet bled. The floor creaked.


Just as Alex wanted to collapse (for some reason, the walk was that treacherous and long...at least to him), Caitlin arrived at her destination. She opened the door, just to reveal that she was only going to the bathroom. Except she wasn't using it's facilities. She was looking at herself in the mirror. Like she loved herself.


Alex asked Caitlin if she was coming out. Caitlin responded, "Come, take a look at me in the mirror. We're beautiful..."


Alex thought, "We're?" as he thought of leaving Caitlin behind and getting out of the house.


So what does Alex do?
1112.title: Follow Caitlin...

11121.content:
Alex looked carefully into the mirror, hoping that he wouldnt see anything bad about himself.

Luckily, he didn't.
"yea... okay..." He said. Suddenly, Caitlin picked him up and threw him into the mirror, oddly enough, it didnt smash, but he seemed to pass into it, as if he was now a reflection of himself. When he got up from falling on the bathroom floor, he looked into the mirror, and Caitlin was staring at him, she had an evil grin on her face, yet she was only in the mirror, not beside him. Alex was really freaking out now.

Suddenly, everything started twisting and turning until everything Alex could see was a cross of black and white and lots of grey. Eventually, everything came back into focus and he hoped that this dream was something of a more safe enviroment.

Alex was standing in a forest clearing, everything was calm and still, not the scary kind of somethings-going-to-jump-out-at-you kind, but the peaceful, this is an intermission kind.

It most certainly was not. Suddenly, out of nowhere, a massive bulldozer came crashing through the trees, knocking everything over in its wake. The thing was at least twenty times the size of a usual bulldozer, but it towered over Alex.

Right before it was about to crush Alex, who couldnt move for some reason and was frantically trying to get away, it stopped, an inch from his nose.
At this point, someone hopped out of the cab and jumped down. At least this person was of normal height, but something was wrong about this person, something was very, very wrong. It was Alex who jumped down.

"Caitlin, what the heck are you doing out here?" He asked, raising his eyebrows, but not in a worried sort of fashion. Wait, he called Alex Caitlin? That cant be... Oh no! Alex looked down at himself and found that he had been fully turned into Caitlin! Alex screamed, but when he did, he found even his voice had changed!

The newer Alex rolled his eyes, and went up and punched our Alex (Who is now for some reason Caitlin) in the face, knocking hi-... 'her' out.

When Alex came too, he was back as himself. This was daunting, scary and he wanted out, as SOON as possible. He tried pinching himself, hitting himself, but nothing worked, he was stuck in this nightmare and it wasnt even halfway yet...

Suddenly, Caitlin appeared, oh why oh why was it always HER?
"It's me or you. Choose" Said Caitlin, almost looking annoyed at you.
11121.title: Alex looks in the mirror... Is that Caitlin?

choices: What happens if you kill Robert?
What happens if you don't kill Robert?
115.content:
Alex slowly made his way to the front door, careful not to alarm any of his family. He opened the door hesitantly and peered through the darkness. It was hard to see through the heaviness of the rain. He shifted his weight to his right foot stepping outside of the doorway. He suddenly felt himself falling forward. He couldn't understand why the ground wasn't catching his fall. It was like he had fallen into an empty void. Some sort of black hole. His body began to pick up speed, traveling so fast that he began to feel heat against his skin. He continued to grow warmer the further and faster he fell. He began to panic, screaming, "Somebody help me. What's going on? Where am I? Why are you doing this to me?" But there was only the echo of his own voice and the wind that surrounded him.
It seemed like he had been falling for an awful long time. The heat continued to grow. Suddenly, the was a flicker of light in the distance below him. It was orange and red and yellow. And then he began to hear what he thought was moaning and screaming intertwined. The light was very hot and he could feel his skin beginning to burn and sting. The screaming got louder as he fell. It began to get close very quick. He knew he was about to come to the end of whatever this place was. The burning became very intense and suddenly he was overcome with the pain of his body slamming to the bottom of the pit.
A loud deep voice laughed at him as he laid the screaming. Alex yelled, "Stop! It hurts! Stop the pain, please. I'll do anything!"
"Anything?" the voice replied. "Now that sounds tempting! But I thought we could have some fun first," he laughed. Then two men came out of the darkness and grabbed Alex's arms and legs. They drug him to a long table covered in blood and fastened him into shackles that were attatched to the table. Alex cried and screamed for them to stop, but they continued like robots obeying a command. He tried to look at the men as he begged them to stop. He was horrified by what he saw. Their flesh was burnt and they had empty, blackened eye sockets. Their fingernails were long and sharp like claws and cut his skin as they held him down.
"What is this place? Who are you? What do you want from me?" Alex kept yelling out. But his voice was drowned out by the other screams in the background. And this evil man just laughed at his misery.
The two men came back over to Alex and began pressing sharp, cold, metal hooks into his chest. The pain was excruciating. He could still feel his flesh blistering from the extreme heat surrounding him. He screamed as his skin ripped open. The pain was so immense that Alex began to go into shock. His eyes became glazed and fixed. All he could do was try to focus on something else, something far away.
He thought of his family. Then he began to remember pieces of waking up in a bizarre reality just before he had fallen into the pit of Hell.
"Maybe I'm still asleep. Yeah, that's it," he thought as he fought back the tears. "This has got to be some sort of dream!"
If only he could just wake up, maybe this nightmare would end.
"I can make all of this suffering go away, if you could give me just one thing," said the man with the evil laugh.
"What is it?" asked Alex.
"Kill your brother!" the man demanded angrily.
"I can't do that" said Alex.
"Then suffer for an eternity!" the man yelled in a very deep voice. He tortured Alex until he gave into the pain.
Just as soon as Alex agreed to kill his only brother, he felt like he'd been hit in the chest until his breath was knocked out of him. He opened his eyes to see that he was laying on his bed again. He couldn't tell if he was awake or still stuck in yet another dream. Just then Robert walked into the room.
115.title: Get out of this creepy house.

choices: Little Girl Gets Hand Caught In Bag Carousel
Old Lady Can't Find Her Wallet
Man Grows Hair and Fangs, Threatens Clerk
12.content:
Alex was in Walmart pushing a shopping buggy. The buggy was filled with stuff he didn't want. A blue pillow. He already HAD a pillow. A boxed DVD set of the I Love Lucy TV show. A thermometer. A bottle of vitamin pills. A clock radio. A box of Cheerios. An Etch-A-Sketch toy. What was he doing with all this stuff? He didn't even have any money.

His shorts fell down. He quickly pulled them back up looking around to see if anybody was looking. Almost everybody in the store was. He looked at the floor and felt his face get red. Time to check out.

It was a long line at the checkout counter. The clerk was so ugly he couldn't look at her. He couldn't even tell if she was a man or a woman because she was so big and had hairy arms but she also had big beanbag breasts on her chest and she was wearing a dress. Her teeth were rotten.

The man behind Alex in line bumped into him. Alex jumped.

"Excuse me," the man said in a whiney voice... but then he bumped Alex again. "I'm so sorry!" Alex wasn't sure what part of the man was bumping him and that was creepy. Then he got bumped a third time. His skin began to itch and he wished the damn checkout line would MOVE! What was holding things up?
12.title: Walmart Weirdos

choices: It Ain't Over Until The Fat Lady Farts
121.content:
It's a checkout line at Walmart filled with weirdos and it just will not move along. Alex wonders why. Then a little girl starts screaming. OMG! She was playing with the bag carousel and got her hand caught in it. Nobody seemed to be doing anything so Alex moves up to help her.

"Hey! Don't break in line!" A fat lady says.

"I'm not!" Alex says. "I just want to help this little girl."

"Don't help that little brat," an old man says. "She had no business messing with that thing."

You tug on the little girl's arm and say, "Don't cry. I'll get you loose."

It doesn't seem like you are tugging all that hard but her hand comes loose from the end of her arm. Blood is gushing out and making a puddle on the floor. You feel sick. "I didn't mean to-"

The old man hits you in the head with his cane. "You sick pervert! Tearing off a little girl's hand! You ought to be castrated!"

The fat lady pushes you down and sits on you. The man who was bumping you in line pulls out a switchblade knife and flicks it open. His whiney voice sets your teeth on edge. "I knew there was something weird about you, boy. He comes at you with the knife.
121.title: Little Girl Screams

choices: Alex tries to find a way out...
13.content:
Alex opened the third door and stepped in to a small dark space that was roughly the size of a coffin. The ground under him was soggy yet jagged like it was covered in shards of rock or perhaps metal.

He could hear running water all around him that sounded like it might be running through pipes or maybe there was a river above him. The room was oldly shaped and most likely made of dirt and mud.

He didn't like this horrible place and tryed to turn around and go back out the door, only to run smack into a slippery wet wall covered in barbed protusions.

"Yeeeaaagg!" Screamed Alex as he fell to the wet floor, scraping his hands on the hard razor-like things that seemed to be stuck in the walls, the floor, and maybe even the ceiling. He simply sat on the small floor for a minute in deep pain before trying to get back up. He fought back tears as he stood back up slowly, trying his hardest to avoid any more injuries.

His arms, his face, and most of the front of his body as well as his legs and his lower back were driping blood and covered in gashes. He was sure that something was sticking out of his back and lower leg. He tried vainly to remove one of the things, but the pain was too much. It was freezeing cold in this tiny place, but poor Alex couldn't tell if it was the dripping walls that seemed to be oozeing ice-cold water or himself as he felt his own blood run down his face and chest.

He was afraid to move, lest he get caught on a metal wire or broken tin can that he now realized this small room was filled with after his fall earlier onto what must have been the remains of some garbagemans collection of trash.

What really scared him was that everything in here was metal and was probaly rusted at that...
13.title: Buried alive...

choices: A way out, finally!...Or is it?
The floor caves out and he falls in.
131.content: Alex was having difficulty finding a way out of this metal and earth-made prison. "C'mon, Alex! Think! There's gotta be a way out of here!" Looking around the area, Alex did his best to find an exit. Suddenly, he heard a loud rumble come from somewhere very close to him. Turning around, Alex found...
131.title: Get out of here!

choices: Before he can choose, the walls crush him.
1313.content: Alex suddenly heard something: "Get...out!!!". Alex jumped, of course, being scared. "That's weird," said Alex "I thought I heard something. I guess not". As if the voice heard him, it repeated what it had previously said, only in a more grim tone: "GET...OUT!!!" Alex knew then that something was up. "I am hearing things. I'm hearing a voice that's saying..." But, before Alex could finish his sentence, the voice interrupted him, and this time, it had more to say: "GET...OUT...OF...MY...HOME!!!" Alex was freaking out: If he didn't get out, he could die. Then again, if he tried to get out, he'd die. Things didn't look good from either direction. In the end, Alex decided to...
1313.title: The voice from nowhere!!!

choices: Alex found he could not let go of the hot handle
Alex did as his father said and let go of the handle
14.content:
Alex walked up to the forth door and brought his hand to the handle.
"Bam! Bam. Bam." Someone on the other side of the door was rapping on it with a intensity.
"Help. Help me please." Alex heard a little girls voice say. Alex heard the little girl scream then go silent. Alex overheard what he sworn was his fathers words. He could not make out what he was saying through the door. Suddenly his father stopped talking and then made his way to the door.
"Alex is that you?"Alex father said in a aggressive irritated voice. Alex said nothing and then he heard his father let out a long sigh before he slowly talked in a calm voice."You really shouldn't spy on your dad Alex." There was a pause then his father said."Of course you really haven't seen anything right? We can just forget about this. It would probably be best if we did. For the both of us.. right? Just simply turn around and forget you heard anything alright? I will talk to you in a minute." The faint sound of the girl speaking in a gurgled dialogue caught Alex off guard. Alex looked down at the handle the now seemed to grow hot in his hand. Just then...
14.title: Father knows best 8-)

141.content: Alex opened the Door. There was Darkness in the Door. "Alex. Say bye bye." Alex heard. Just then Alex came falling down. It seemed to last forever...
141.title: 1st Hour Start.

choices: Alex father ask him what he is doing
142.content: The handle grew hotter in his hand. Alex went to remove his hand from the handle only to find that his hand seemed to be stuck. The handle grew hotter and Alex felt the heat start to radiate through his hand. Alex heard faint murmurs from the little girl from the other side of the voice and then felt the intensity of the heat increase. Alex felt the handle begin to burn at his flesh and he started to panic. The smell ran up through his nose and Alex began moving his hand wildly tugging and hitting at the handle with his other hand. Alex wiggled the handle more and more in a effort to free his now searing hand from the red hot handle.
142.title: Hot

choices: Alex closes the door. (slamming it accidentally)
1421.content:
Alex tugged at the handle harder beating at it with his free hand wiggling at it in a fierce motion. The door suddenly opened and Alex fell to the floor grabbing his hand in pain. The handle had a small embroiled circle on it that now glowed and then went dark as the handle cooled. Alex looked down at his hand at the impression of the circle now burnt into the palm. The searing pain of the handle was quickly forgotten as Alex noticed the door was open.

The door was open a few inches, but apparently his father had not noticed. A beam of light shined through the small sliver and Alex could hear his father talking to the little girl more clearly.
"..you have been through worse then this I don't see why.." Alex looked at the small sliver of light shinning through the door and then moved closer curiously.
1421.title: A reminder or a warning

choices: Alex refuses and walks inside the room
"It is not real. Just a nightmare" and Alex shuts the door
14211.content:
Alex's gaze went inward looking into the dimly lit room. Inside the room laying face down on the bed was the form of a small girl. Alex's view was obstructed by a shadow standing at the foot of the bed. The form shifted it's massive mass and Alex caught a glimpse at what he could have sworn was his father. The man stood before Alex the sweat running down his forehead a subtle glow of rage building in his face.

Alex looked over at the girl who now could be seen fully. Her hands and feet were bound with rope that, even in the dim room, Alex could see had gouged into her skin. Her blouse had been ripped from her form and she lay on the bed exposed.

"Alex what the fuck are you doing in her get the hell out. Now!" Alex's father yelled at him as he walked closer towards the door. Alex looked back at the bed to the young girl and seen the bruises for the first time.
14211.title: Exposed

choices: His father slams the closet closed
142111.content:
"Bad choice there boy." Alex's Father said. Alex's father seem huge standing taller. He towered over Alex as he moved closer and then brought his hand to the door slamming it shut.
Alex's father gripped his arm before he flung the teenager across the room. Alex slammed into the closet door before falling on all fours. Looking back Alex seen his father already standing over him. Alex's father brought his foot up into his gut. The force of the blow sucked the breath from the teenager before his father applied another sending him into the closet. Hunched over Alex looked around the inside of the closet before...
142111.title: Teenagers

choices: Alex realizing he is gripping a baseball bat
Alex realizes he is gripping a folding chair
1421112.content:
With a sudden surge of adrenalin Alex brought his foot into His fathers shin. Alex's father let out a wail cussing under his breath out of habit before bringing the injured shin upright taking a step away from the closet. Alex father looked down at the girl that was now moving on the bed trying to get free of the ropes.

"Stop moving I will be with you in a minute. Need to deal with this little.. " Alex's father's words trailed off as he shuffled through the drawer.

Inside the closet the sudden rush of adrenalin had brought Alex back into a rational state. Looking over Alex felt his hand brush across something wooden.
"Just you stay right there... Fucking mistake! I should have done this years ago" Alex's father says as a small pistol is pulled from the drawer.
1421112.title: Adrenalin boost

14211121.content:
Alex's father brought the gun up and pointed at into the closet and then pulled back the trigger. The sound of the pistols unsuccessful action cycling through the motions brought a confused look to Alex's fathers face.
"Damn it!" Alex father through the gun across the room and then turned back and looked to the girl. She was moving on the bed with wide eyes trying to say something.
"Stop moving Damn it." Alex's father brought a open hand against the girls cheek. The sound of the slap echoed through the room. Despite the pain the girl continued to protest trying to speak through the gag.

Alex looked down at the girl and the fear in her eyes before she was spattered with a cluster of blood. Alex continued swinging the bat in a fierce intensity. The sound of the bones skull cracking could be heard but Alex kept going. The form fell next to the bed next the girl and looked into her face as Alex kept swinging.

The girl looked down at Alex's father with pity in her eyes before Alex finally dropped the bat breathing heavily. Alex looked at the girl and then moved closer reaching for the gag. She wiggled and tried to get away from the boy that had just murdered his father.
"It's alright don't worry. He can't hurt you" Alex managed to say with staggered breathing as he reached over and removed the gag.
14211121.title: Swinging for the fences

142111212.content:
"What the hell? Why would you? You stupid little " The girl began gasping. Alex looked down at her confused. His father was about to rape the young girl it was a matter of minutes. If he had not come in when he did it was certain. It was obvious his father was in a ludicrous state. If the gun had had bullets it Alex would have been the one dead.
"Do you know? Do you know what you have done?" The girl suddenly screamed.
"I..I saved you. He was about to.."Alex staggered with his thoughts trying to form words.
"No, you have not saved me. You have .. and now it will come back. Why could you have not simply listened to him. Who knows what..." the girl suddenly went quiet Alex looked at her face as she went pale. At first Alex thought she was looking at him then heard the closet door close behind him. Alex slowly turned around and seen...
142111212.title: Do you know what you have done?

choices: I put it in a swamp nearby
I put it in the burn barrel(for burning trash)
1421112122.content:
"Poor form Alex. Don't you know you should listen to your parents" The man said looking at Alex's father laying on the floor.
"And you, Elizabeth you have been at this longer then him you should have expected something like this." The man let out a sigh and then glanced over at a trunk in the corner of the room.
"Get in." The man said looking at the girl. Alex tried to protest but found he could have not speak.
"You have done enough to this woman Alex. I will speak with you concerning your interference in a minute." The man said as he watched the woman walk over and open the trunk and get inside. The man looked at the girl with a disappointed face and then closed the lid looking back at Alex.

"There are certain rules Alex. You simply can not barge in and interrupt someone's nightmare." The man let out a sigh and then stepped over Alex's father's corpse. As the man stepped over the corpse it decayed rapidly. The smell of rotting flesh filled Alex's nostrils causing him to gag. Within a minute the rotting flesh had turned into maggots that soon after turned into flies. The flies moved throughout the room and then moved over to the trunk before they all rested on the trunk. The flies sat quietly not moving a single wing looking at the man.
Alex when you were six you hit a rabbit with your bike. Do you remember that? Do you remember coming back later that night on your bike and placing the rabbit into a shoe box Alex? I was wondering what did you do with that shoe box once you placed the puppy inside?" The man in the suit asked looking at Alex who was in awe.

Alex had told no one about it. It was a accident, He had been biking and the rabbit had run out and under his bike. Thinking back to it Alex could still hear the high pitched scream it made as it withered on the pavement of the nature trail. Alex had been quiet the whole night and then the guilt began to build. around midnight he took a old shoebox and put it in his backpack and went out to the spot where the dead rabbit lay. Alex placed the rabbit in the box and then heard the sound of something moving in the bushes. He moved his flashlight around wildly with the shoebox under his arm before jumping on his bike.

"Alex what did you do with the box?" The man said with a smile. Alex looked at the man and then said..
1421112122.title: You can not run from your past

14211121222.content:
I put it in the burn barrel putting some things on top so no one could see and Lit it along with the rest of the trash."Alex said with a shallow regret of a tone in his voice before pausing.
"I wanted it to be happy. I wanted it to.." Alex trailed his words off looking at the man shaking his head back and forth.
"No, Alex you wanted to cover it up. Not have anyone find it. We know more about you then you are aware of Alex. And we also know that rabbit was not the only accident." The man said quoting accident with his fingers before looking over at the flies as they began to glow.
"Fire flies what a interesting concept. You know many people find fire flies beautiful, romantic even." The man said watching the flies began to wander inside the keyhole of the trunk.
"The thing most people don't realize is that fire flies like many things here have a deeper meaning. And while a small flame can seem romantic.." The mans words trailed off as Elizabeth screamed as the first firefly began crawling over her scorching her skin as it drug it self against her. More fire flies began to enter the keyhole faster now as the screaming inside the trunk increased. Alex looked over at the trunk that began shaking as a small stream of smoke trailed out of the key hole.
"What are you doing? Stop it your hurting her." Alex said looking at the man.
"I thought of all people you would want this Alex. She was in pain and now because of you she can be happy just like the rabbit." The man said increasing his tone to speak over the screams inside the trunk.
"Stop let her out." Alex said walking over to the trunk putting his hands to the lock feeling the warmth inside the trunk trying to ignore the screams that echoed against it.
"Where is the key!" Alex yelled as rage filled his eyes.
"You have done this Alex you have done this to her. Now because of you she will begin again." The man said.
The trunk suddenly stopped and the smell of burning flesh echoed through the keyhole accompanied with a black smoke. The man handed Alex a key and then tapped his shoulder.
"Perhaps a introduction is in order. You see Alex for your crimes through out your life you are being punished. It is only justifiable I mean look what you have done to your poor father over there what kind of a person does such a thing and expects no recourse to be taken. It is best while you are here if you do not interfere with any other people's regrets and worries. You will only make it worse like you have for poor Elizabeth. You know she was so close so very close to moving on. It was something I was looking forward to." The man let out a sigh then noticed Alex holding the key.
14211121222.title: A introduction

choices: Opened the bedroom door(the man is gone)
142111212221.content:
" I would advise against that." the man said as he watched Alex stare at the lock. Alex pushed the key into the lock forcibly and then turned it slowly hearing the tumblers click before the trunk sprung open. There was a cloud of black smoke that filled the room in a instant and scorched Alex's face. He stood up in reeling in pain taking steps away from the trunk. The pain from the blisters subsided quickly and Alex looked back at the man and then at the trunk.
The inside had been burnt to a crisp leaving a black charcoal surface with veins of cracked wood. Alex remained puzled though of the absence of Elizabeth.

"Where is she?' Alex finally managed to ask.
"I have told you, she has begun again. It will be harder this time though they will make sure of it." The man said with remorse in his face. The man suddenly perked his head up as if a alarm had gone off.
"A new entry. Alex I really must go. Know this, that key you hold will open many doors and help you along the way. Be careful though, because not all paths are advised. They have certain demands that must be met before you can move on." The man said in a hurried voice before walking over to the bedroom door closing it behind him.
Alex rushed after the man and pulled at the door only to find it locked. He pulled the key up to it and then stopped noticing the closet door next to him had a similar lock. Alex...
142111212221.title: The key

142111212222.content:
Alex kept the case closed, it was better that way, sweat seemed to drift off his very pores as the trunk started rattling slightly. Alex sweatdropped and tried to sit on it to no avail, but the man noticed and said a curse-word, which startled him:
"Flotsbaggen!! You're keeping it closed?" His hands were talons of hatred, "Don't you know what happens to those who refuse the call?" The man's skeleton started showing through as the flesh burnt right off him. "You need... a skeleton key" At this, the pinky on his right hand snapped off succintly with a sickening crack. Alex gulped
142111212222.title: Keep the trunk closed

1423.content:
As Alex struggled to break free, he began to hear footsteps coming through the door. Something was approaching on the other side. With every step, hot air was whipped through the edge of the door frame and flowed over Alex's body. The air was hot enough to feel very uncomfortable, but not scorching or truly painful. Unlike the handle.

Alex's hand was steadily being overcome with pain. The searing metal that had fused with his skin burned ever hotter, and was now emitting a faint orange glow. Alex began to scream, even worse than the pain itself was its gradual increase. When would it stop? How badly would it scar my hand? Alex's mind was flooded with the grimmest of scenarios as his hand was charred, now down to the bone, by the glowing metal handle.

"I'm dying!"

He cried out, his face displaying great anguish, his mind ready to blank out in a desperate attempt to escape the pain. Then, the foot steps came again, followed by a dark distorted voice.

"Alex."

It was his father calling from the other side.

"Dad? Dad help me, I'm burning! I can't feel my skin, help me! Don't let me die!"

Alex pleaded with his father's voice, praying that his suffering would end, but his father did not seem to understand.

"Alex. I told you to go."

The foot steps were now mad stomps, the ground buckled after every impact, and the entire building seemed to weaken as whatever roamed past the door drew closer.

"Dad, I'm sorry, it's not my fault, it's killing me!"

"No, no, you disobeyed. Why? You do not..." Alex's father roared, and another stomp rocked the entire Earth. "You do not disobey me!"

Alex felt something slam him just below the chin, then he lost track of the ground, as he could no longer feel it through his feet. Splinters of wood cut and nicked him, and the burning shards that had comprised the handle branded his flesh as they scattered. Alex found solid ground again when his head crashed into something, and his body fell to the ground. He was stunned, he was burned, he was panting. He could not feel the hand that had been burned, and he was too weak to move his body and examine his wounds. As Alex lay, staring up at blinding white lights perched on some far off darkness, he could only heard the voice of his father once again, now even more twisted, and clearly enraged.

"ALEX."

"YOU DISOBEYED, WHY DO YOU TRY TO UPSET ME? WHY DO YOU," The sound of twisting, scraping metal filled the air "TORMENT ME!"

Alex somehow managed to raise his body against the wall behind him, he could see his father standing a few feet in front of him. The man stood with his legs spread, and arms out from his sides. His hands were fully open, and shaking. In the darkness, Alex could not see his face.

"WHY, WHY, WHY?" Alex's farther was hysterical, he was screaming madly, and began slamming himself on the floor and walls. Then he seemed to calm down.

"Alex, I didn't mean to. I just feel so empty sometimes. Sometimes, it's so hard. I just need something to fill me. That's why I take them."

His farther came forward, and now Alex could see that he was holding something. As he slowly walked forward, the object was lit up more and more by the overhanging lights. Then, Alex could see it all.

It was a head, it looked like the head of a little girl, perhaps from the one that had been screaming. It was marred by a deep cut down the side from which still fresh blood poured, and the eyes were wide open, one looking straight ahead, the other tilted up. As the head dangled from it's hair, which was gripped tightly in Alex's father's hand, the girl's jaw was only barely attached and twisted about a tendon and some strands of badly cut muscle.

"They fill me Alex, they do."

As Alex sat barely able to understand, his father took the girl's hair into his mouth and bit down on it. With his now free hand, he took his other arm and pulled. Without so much as a flinch, he broke the arm. The delicate bone and muscle below the skin snapped and popped loudly, but he was not done. He rose both arms over his head, and then pulled again. He began to breath quickly, and veins expanded through his skin all over his body. His breaths began beast like grunts as the skin on his arm began to tear. He then reached into the mutilated arm and took hold of the bone. He violently, relentlessly tugged on it, throwing himself back and forth. The shattered bone made a fine knife, and with it, he managed to cut away the surrounding soft flesh.

Alex wanted to scream, but his voice was gone. His entire body had shut down, he had only his senses as he lay frozen in shock and terror.

"It is so good Alex, I just can't help it. You understand don't you?"

Alex's father then took one last tug on the bone. He pulled out the insides of his arm, all the way to the shoulder. All that was left was a sleeve of empty skin that dropped flat against the body.

"I can taste her, yes."

He took the child's head and proceeded to stuff it into the emptied arm socket, as if it was a mouth.. Everything went in, save for the jaw, which finally broke off and fell to the floor. Alex's father quickly bent down and scooped it up. He leaned his head back, with his eyes now bursting out of his head, and slowly parted his mouth. The jaw dropped right in, and he crunched away at it with his own teeth.

"You understand Alex, don't you?"
1423.title: Alex father ask him what he is doing

choices: Alex ignores the voice and runs towards the girl's screams
Alex asks the voice what it wants
143.content:
he let go, just as his father had asked.
"That's a good boy Alex. Now turn around and go. Forget what you saw here."
Alex turned to walk away. After a few steps, he looked down at his hand. A blister was forming where the door handle had burned him. He stopped to touch it. He felt pain.
"This doesn't make any sense" he thought to himself. "This is just a dream".
He turned around and headed back towards his father, who was still standing outside the door.
"Alex, I thought I told you to go."
"You can't tell me what to do". Alex replied. "You aren't real."
Alex's father began to laugh. He shook his head to side to side and responded "Oh Alex, you just don't get it. You never did."
"Who is that girl?" Alex asked.
"What girl?" Alex's father peeked through the door and looked back at Alex. "I don't see any girl."
"There was a girl crying for help on the other side of this door before you opened it."
"Help me! Alex help me!" It was the little girl.
"That's her, that's the girl I heard. How does she know my name?"
"Alex, turn around and walk away" his father yelled at him.
Alex started to turn away and then made a run towards the door, shoving his father out of the way. He stepped through the doorway and immediately felt the floor fall out beneath him. He began to fall. There was no light. Just a black hole of darkness. He screamed, but he could not hear his own voice.

This is just a dream...as Alex reminded himself of this, he gave in to the darkness. And no sooner did he give in, he found himself lying on a cold,damp concrete floor.
"You should have listened to your father." a deep voice spoke into Alex's ear. He jumped back to see who the voice belonged to, but he couldn't see through the darkness.
"Who are you?" Alex cried out.
"Alex! Help me!" It was the girl.
"Who are you?" Alex cried out.
"Let it go." the voice whispered into Alex's ear.
"Why?"
"Just walk away."
Ignoring the voice, Alex started to walk towards the girl's voice.
"If you go you will never wake up."
"And if I stay?"
"You will have to do something for me".
143.title: Alex did as his father said and let go of the h...

choices: A giant hand grabs him and pulls him in.
15.content: Alex opened the door...and nearly fell into a pit when he found the door led to a giant portal that led to nowhere. "Now THAT is a close call" siad Alex. Terror aside, he was ready to leave when...
15.title: Pathway to nowhere

info.brief_description: Over the course of 24 hours, your dreams drive you nuts. Scary as possible, please.
info.description:
Okay, this is my 2nd Interactive. You may remember the 1st, it was happy and random (The Necklace's Curse). This one is scary and random.


The characters are (and feel free to add more):

Alex Drake - 17 years old, average person, nothing too special...about to go through some serious insanity.

Caitlin Drake - 23 years old, Alex's older sister

Robert Drake - 14 years old, Alex's annoying little brother

Mom and Dad - Alex's parents

Nightmare - A strange being that appears in Alex's dreams one night...

Basically, I don't care what you do with the above characters (except Alex and Nightmare). They're just characters that you can change on a whim if you feel like (and trust me you'll be able to).


Here's how we do this little dance:

Alex goes to sleep. And doesn't wake up (though you can wake him in the 24th hour, see below). Nightmare keeps him asleep and puts him through nightmarish scenarios (duh), designed to drive him insane.

There are 24 hours in a day. Every chapter is one hour. So, at the end of the 24th in ANY storyline, you must write a disturbing end for each storyline. You are NOT allowed to end the story unless it is the 24th hour. And yes, he can wake up in the 24th hour, but make it more than "It was all a dream", perhaps have him wake to something worse.

An important note is that before it was stated that you needed to put the hour. That's not needed, since the chapter number is the hour. Chapter Number = Hour. Okay, enough said.


There are no limits per se, but remember this is a horror story. So...do not turn this into some sexual fantasy or whatever. Be as scary as possible. Thank you.


Those that write VERY scary chapters may get bonuses like GP or their handle posted on this page. And sorry, you're going to need more than gore to scare me. (UPDATE: Due to school and personal projects...I can no longer maintain the GP and Handle Posts. I apologize and hope you continue to enjoy the story and add to it.)


Also, I want chapters that are NOT one sentence. Those may get deleted. Descriptive, nightmarish chapters please (aim for 3 paragraphs or so to be safe, unless you can describe it in less).

Make sense so far? Go start your nightmare now.

HANDLE POSTS:
First Fright - Steve ~ Friction
Claustrophobia Inducer - evil dude
Scary Supporter - cerial
